oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Replication Data for: 'Inoculation of seedlings alters fungal communities but does not improve their performance in beetle-killed sites'
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Wasyliw, Josh
Fellrath, Evan G.
Cale, Jon
Franklin, James
Thomasson, Charlotte
Pec, Gregory J.
Erbilgin, Nadir
Karst, Justine
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Outbreaks of mountain pine beetle in western North America could have long lasting consequences for forest trajectories. In particular, changes to the soil fungal community, which accompany outbreaks, could impede successful seedling regeneration.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Earth and Environmental Sciences
pine
mountain pine beetle
fungi
ectomycorrhiza
soil
